August Was Made for No Socks “Right away Turbonomic had my socks blown off… it did the whole thing for you.…We have definitely been on a journey to hybrid cloud and we could not have done it without Turbonomic.” – John Belcher, Principal Infrastructure Engineer, MetroStar Systems Watch the Video <[[https://resources.turbonomic.com/accelerate-cloud-migration-projects/metrostar-success-story]]> | Read the Case Study <[[https://resources.turbonomic.com/case-studies/metrostar-case-study]]>
Have you heard? Turbonomic is for any cloud—hybrid cloud, multicloud, your cloud, the other guy’s cloud... So, we’re thrilled to share MetroStar’s story where making workloads SMART (self-managing, anywhere, in real-time) is helping them on their cloud journey. And what perfect timing too, because who needs socks in August.
By automating Turbonomic AWS storage tier optimization recommendations, they were able to ensure performant workloads, while reducing their monthly spend by 25% and freeing their teams from babysitting dashboards. If you’d like to learn more about how you can leverage Turbonomic storage automation to optimize your on-prem or public cloud environments, check out this live demo: Storage Automation On-Premises and in the Cloud with Turbonomic Workload Automation <[[https://resources.turbonomic.com/on-demand-webinars/live-demo-storage-automation-on-premises-and-in-the-cloud-with-turbonomic-workload-automation]]>.
August is also the month where many of you will be enjoying a well-earned vacation. We wish you safe travels, perfect weather, and ignorable inboxes!

The Enterprises Project recently published five tips to avoid cloud sticker shock. One of the five tips is to automate as much as possible. Turbonomic's Cloud CTO, Mor Cohen, comments on the importance of self-managing workloads to solve the challenges of dynamic, fluctuating workloads distributed across complex environments, and the countless important scaling and placement decisions that must be made. Learn more here <[[https://enterprisersproject.com/article/2018/7/how-avoid-cloud-sticker-shock?page=1]]>.
